properties.description: Confronting chaos and order through anarchic line drawings and political gesture.

properties.description: A reflective, mirrored exhibition exploring repetition and reflection through minimalist drawing.

properties.description: Reflecting on Romanian revolutions and memory through collaborative drawing interventions.

properties.title: Ecou Brâncuși
properties.description: An echo of Brâncuși’s forms rendered in drawing, performance and dialogue.

properties.description: A trilingual exhibition contemplating the museum’s role across cultures and languages.

properties.description: Exploring facets of humanity through fragmented drawing and narrative.

properties.description: Elegantly drawn commentary on urban life and sophistication in the capital.

properties.title: Document
properties.description: A drawing-based examination of documentary practices, trace, and archive.

properties.description: A layered conversation with Brâncuși—after, beyond, without—expressed in drawing.

properties.title: AntiOscar
properties.description: A satirical project engaging with cinema, awards, and counter-narratives.

properties.description: Exhibition confronting social awakening and protest culture in Romania.

properties.description: Part of Europalia Romania festival, exploring transparency and fragility in drawing.

properties.description: Exhibition engaging with political crises and contradictions of the modern age.

properties.description: An experimental drawing-based exhibition within a media art institution.

properties.description: Pop-up display and performance exploring the notion of reverse donation in art.

properties.description: Playful exhibition at Sandwich II, engaging with global attractions and absurdities.

properties.title: Breaking the News & UFOtopia
properties.description: Joint exhibition with Cristian Răduță, exploring the intersection of news and speculative utopias.

properties.description: Exhibition addressing the visual language of politics through drawing interventions.

properties.title: Bits and Fragments
properties.description: Exhibition with Lia Perjovschi exploring fragments of memory and narrative.

properties.description: University exhibition dealing with unfiltered news and media critique.
